item.title: Episode 10: Time and Priority Management
item.description: Here’s the 10th episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “What’s your method for personal and professional time/priority management?” My guests are Quintessence Anx, Technical Evangelist at AppDynamics; Laura Santamaria (me!), Developer Advocate at LogDNA; and Paul Czarkowski, Developer Advocate at VMware.

item.title: Episode 9: Status Updates
item.description: Here’s the 9th episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “How do you give status updates to your boss?” My guests are Sasha Rosenbaum, Product Manager at GitHub; Quintessence Anx, Technical Evangelist at AppDynamics; and Dawn Parzych, Developer Advocate at LaunchDarkly.

item.title: Episode 8: Such Community
item.description: Here’s the 8th episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “How do you stay visibly present and active in all of your different community forums and chat channels?” My guests are Mary Thengvall, Director of Developer Relations at Camunda; Leon Stigter, Cloud Developer Advocate at VMware; Sasha Rosenbaum, Product Manager at GitHub; Aaron Aldrich, Developer Advocate at Taggy-Flaggy (@LaunchDarkly); Quintessence Anx, Technical Evangelist at AppDynamics; Chris Short, Principal Technical Marketing Manager at Red Hat; and PJ Hagerty, Founder/Chief Community Officer at DevRelate.

item.title: Episode 7: Learning New Things
item.description: Here’s the 7th episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “How do you make time for learning new things?” My guests are Paul Czarkowski, Dawn Parzych, Sasha Rosenbaum, and JJ Asghar.

item.title: Episode 6: Friday Deploys
item.description: Here’s the 6th episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “Do you deploy on Fridays? Why or why not?” My guests are Dawn Parzych, Leon Stigter, and Quintessence Anx.

item.title: Episode n: Silly Answers Only
item.description: We thought a Silly Answers Only episode was in order to bring a smile to folks’ faces. Our question for this “round” is “How would you rebrand DevOps (silly answers only)?” My guests are Leon Stigter, Dawn Parzych and son, Sasha Rosenbaum, Quintessence Anx, and Matt Stratton.

item.title: Episode 5: DevOps Implementation
item.description: Here’s the 5th episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “When looking to implement DevOps principles into your company, what are some first steps?” Our guests are Sasha Rosenbaum, H. “Waldo” Grunenwald, Quintessence Anx, and Paul Czarkowski.

item.title: Episode 4: DevOps Meaning
item.description: Here’s the 4rd episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “What does DevOps mean to you?” Our guests are Leon Stigter, Austin Parker, JJ Asghar, Daniel Maher, Quintessence Anx, and Matt Stratton.

item.title: Episode 3: Avoiding Shiny Things
item.description: Here’s the 3rd episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “How do you avoid ‘shiny things’?” Our guests are Quintessence Anx, Marky Jackson, Paul Czarkowski, Leon Stigter, and Chris Short.

item.title: Episode 2: Working from Home
item.description: Here’s the second episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “How do you work from home safely, successfully, and happily?” Our guests are Aaron Aldrich, Jeremy Meiss, Daniel Maher, Chuck Tomasi, Andrew Barnes, Chris Short, Quintessence Anx, and Dawn Parzych – with a very special guest!

item.title: Process
item.description: Thanks for joining me on this adventure! This doc will be updated with the most current guidelines and details on how to participate. Question Crowdsourcing Process The call for questions will go out once a week on the hashtag #AMinuteOnTheMic on Twitter. For now, these posts are going out on my personal account. Video Guidelines Videos MUST be 60 seconds or less (59.99 seconds, the three nines of mic time).

item.title: Episode 1: Toil
item.description: Here’s the first episode of A Minute on the Mic! Our question this round is “If you could eliminate one source of toil, what would it be?” Our guests are JJ Asghar, Chris Short, Kat Cosgrove, Ken Mugrage, Matty Stratton, Dawn Parzych, Paul Czarkowski, Quintessence Anx, Leon Stigter, and Sasha Rosenbaum.

item.title: About A Minute on the Mic
item.description: A Minute on the Mic is a curated video series where the curator (Laura Santamaria) takes a crowd-sourced question from Twitter, finds experts, and gives each expert a chance to answer the question in one minute in a recorded response. Then, all of those responses are compiled into a single video and released for everyone to watch. In curating these videos, I hope that we can start getting a sense of how we collectively work, how we collectively think, and how we collectively can go do great things.
